N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 403.4 - Case management

State Regulations
(a) Staff of the social services district
shall have basic responsibility for case management, which means those
activities necessary for initiating and continuing the provision of services on
a case-by-case basis. Such responsibility includes: (1)
determining eligibility for
services; (2)
developing a plan of
service, consistent with an applicable employability plan developed in
accordance with section
385.4
(a) of this

Title on the basis of an evaluation or reevaluation of the client's situation
for the purpose of achieving an identified service goal; (3)
authorizing the scope, type of duration
of services to be provided; (4)
assessing the quality and appropriateness of services provided; (5)
maintaining such recipient and services
information as required by the department; and
(6)
reporting information as required by the
department. (b) These
activities shall not be delegated or purchased. When services are purchased by
the social services district, the district may request that the provider obtain
and transmit to the district the information necessary to perform the case
management function. Such an arrangement shall be clearly specified in the
purchase of services contract with the provider. (c) In managing multiple service cases, a
strong consideration shall be given to the establishment of a case manager
system so as to minimize costly duplication of effort and reduce confusion on
the part of the client and the worker. Notes
